intro: Eurya luchunensis, commonly known as the Luchun eurya, is a species of flowering plant in the family Ericaceae. It is native to China, specifically the Yunnan Province, where it grows in moist, shaded environments within mountainous regions. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves and clusters of white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in late spring. Its fruit is a small, leathery capsule containing several seeds. Eurya luchunensis is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and ecological adaptations in its native habitat.
